## Commit Message Guidelines

We use semantic-release syntax for messaging.

- ğŸ˜„ Emojis add clarity and fun to commit messages.
- ğŸ·ï¸ They help visually categorize the type of change.
- ğŸ‘€ Emojis make scanning commit history faster and more engaging.
- ğŸ¤ They foster a positive, expressive team culture.
- âš¡ï¸ Emojis can highlight breaking changes or important updates.
- ğŸ“š They make our project history more memorable and welcoming.

- chore: (for changes that do not modify the public API, will not trigger a release)
- fix: (for bug fixes, triggers a patch release)
- feat: (for new features, triggers a minor release)
- BREAKING CHANGE: (in the body or footer, triggers a major release)
